title: 115_s2031
content: The "Kisatchie National Forest Land Conveyance Act" authorizes the conveyance of certain Federal land in the Kisatchie National Forest in Louisiana for market value consideration. The Act defines terms such as "Collins Camp Properties," "Secretary," and "State." The "Kisatchie National Forest Land Conveyance Act" allows the Secretary to convey Federal land in Louisiana by quitclaim deed for public or private sale. The land includes specified parcels in Winn Parish. During a 1-year period, there is a first right of purchase for the land. During a 1-year period, the Secretary will convey specified Federal land in Louisiana to Collins Camp Properties by quitclaim deed. The land includes Collins Campsites and another parcel, with the Secretary having the authority to configure the land for conveyance to maximize marketability or achieve management objectives. The Secretary will convey Federal land in Louisiana to Collins Camp Properties by quitclaim deed to maximize marketability or achieve management objectives. Consideration for the conveyance shall be in cash equal to the market value determined by an appraisal approved by the Secretary. In any conveyance of Federal land under this Act, the Secretary must disclose hazardous substances but is not required to remediate them. This section does not affect the application of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 to Federal land conveyances. SEC. 5 states that the proceeds from the sale of Federal land must be deposited into a specific fund. SEC. 6 addresses the administration of the Act. The Secretary requires Collins Camp Properties to pay appraisal and analysis costs for the conveyance of Federal land. Collins Camp Properties must obtain written statements from holders of Forest Service special use authorizations agreeing to relinquish them upon acquisition of the land. The Secretary requires Collins Camp Properties to administer the special use authorization until it expires if the written authorization is not provided as required.
